In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here is a simple function `clean_column` in Julia.

```julia
function clean_column(col::String)
    # Lowercase the string and replace spaces and hyphens with underscores
    return lowercase(replace(col, r"[ _-]+" => "_"))
end
```
This function `clean_column` takes a string argument (`col`) representing a column name. It first converts all characters in this string to lowercase using the `lowercase` function, then replaces any sequence of spaces or hyphens with an underscore using the regular expression `r"[ _-]+"` and the `replace` function.

You can use it like so:

```julia
println(clean_column("My Column")) # prints "my_column"
```
